text: Andrey Loginov (born 3 March 1972 in Tiraspol, Moldovan SSR) is a retired Russian middle distance runner who specialized in the 800 and 1500 metres. ==Achievements== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing the |- |1990 |World Junior Championships |Plovdiv, Bulgaria |align="center" | 6th |1500 m |3:44.79 |- |1991 |European Junior Championships |Thessaloniki, Greece |align="center" | 4th |1500 m |3:53.81 |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |rowspan=3|1994 |European Indoor Championships |Paris, France |bgcolor="gold" align="center" | 1st |800 m |1:46.38 |- |European Championships |Helsinki, Finland |5th (sf) |800m |1:46.18 |- |Goodwill Games |St. Petersburg, Russia |bgcolor="gold" align="center" | 1st |800 m |1:46.65 |} ==External links== * Category:1972 births Category:Living people Category:Russian male middle-distance runners Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1996 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of Russia Category:Goodwill Games medalists in athletics
title: Andrey Loginov
